Package com.example.recipeoop_1.config

Class MongoConfig

java.lang.Object
org.springframework.data.mongodb.config.MongoConfigurationSupport
org.springframework.data.mongodb.config.AbstractMongoClientConfiguration
com.example.recipeoop_1.config.MongoConfig
@Configuration public class MongoConfig extends org.springframework.data.mongodb.config.AbstractMongoClientConfiguration
Configuration class for MongoDB connection and setup.

This class extends AbstractMongoClientConfiguration to provide customized MongoDB client and template beans. It reads the MongoDB connection URI from application properties and sets the default database name.

Since:
2025-05-14

  • Field Details

    • mongoUri

      @Value("${MONGODB_URI:mongodb+srv://elieissa:1234@cluster0.wgnomye.mongodb.net/recipe_db?retryWrites=true&w=majority&appName=Cluster0}") private String mongoUri
      The MongoDB connection URI. This value is injected from the application properties (MONGODB_URI). A default URI is provided if the property is not set.

  • Method Details

    • getDatabaseName

      protected String getDatabaseName()
      Specifies the name of the MongoDB database to be used by the application.
      Specified by:
      getDatabaseName in class org.springframework.data.mongodb.config.MongoConfigurationSupport
      Returns:
      The database name, which is "recipe_db".

    • mongoClient

      @Bean @Primary public com.mongodb.client.MongoClient mongoClient()
      Creates and configures the primary MongoClient bean.

      This client is responsible for connecting to the MongoDB server specified by mongoUri. It logs whether the URI pattern is valid before attempting to create the client.

      Overrides:
      mongoClient in class org.springframework.data.mongodb.config.AbstractMongoClientConfiguration
      Returns:
      The configured MongoClient instance.
      See Also:
      • Primary

    • mongoTemplate

      @Bean @Primary public org.springframework.data.mongodb.core.MongoTemplate mongoTemplate() throws Exception
      Creates and configures the primary MongoTemplate bean.

      The MongoTemplate provides a high-level abstraction for interacting with MongoDB, simplifying database operations. It uses the configured mongoClient() and getDatabaseName().

      Returns:
      The configured MongoTemplate instance.
      Throws:
      Exception - if an error occurs during the creation of the MongoTemplate, for example, if the mongoClient() cannot be created.
      See Also:
      • Primary
